_header: The joy of our heart is away I-went
Subjects: sermons, verse in; laments, sinners’; scripture texts, Engl. trans. of; translations
_description: Sinners’ lament at the end of the sermon, Apprehende arma et scutum — two couplets

CULIi38.Transcription:
Þe ioie of oure herte is a wei y wentoure song is to sorwe
                    isentþe croune of oure heued is falle to groundeþat euere we
                    wengede allas þe stounde
CULIi38.Note:
Not in Wimbledon’s sermon here; follows the sermon Apprehende
                        arma et scutum (ff. 41-43v); variant version
CULIi38.Editions:
Stemmler,  Theo. 
             “More English Texts from MS. Cambridge University Library
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Anglia
         93 (1975): 1-16: 4.
